bulky 2 join with a jogless technique the one i use involves basically slipping off the first stitch hence cast on is x+1 add your start of round stitch marker 3 if you intend to do a crocheted edge knit one round in colour a to give yourself a nice border 4 knit in your chosen pattern from here on incorporating a jogless method for the first stich of every round methods of finishing off your scrunchie 1 for the crocheted edge knit one round in colour a for a nice border 2 bind off in whatever style you prefer i do a basic one but i m sure a stretchy one would serve a scrunchie very well 3 do not cut off the yarn slip a locking stitch marker into the live stitch while you wrangle the scrunchie and hairtie 2 dianna truong version 1b july 2025 constructing your scrunchie 1 flip your scrunchie inside out just be careful the ends especially the live end doesn t get wrapped inside wrong 2 wrap your hairtie around it and use locking stitch markers to align the pattern along the edges 3 now you can join in two ways listed below 4 after that cut the yarn and do a square knot with the end from the cast on and hide your ends inside the scrunchie but jabbing a yarn needle in and then out at some other point 3 dianna truong version 1b july 2025 crocheted edge 1 using a crochet hook i use 2 5 mm but 3 0 mm would work too do a round of slip stitches along the cast on and bind off stitches 2 start from the live loop you left how convenient 3 catch the loop of each stitch towards the middle for a less bulky edge front loop of row furthest from you and back loop of row closest to you stitched edge 1 cut the yarn off with enough length to stitch and pull through your live loop 2 using a yarn needle do the mattress stitch along the edge 3 my mattress stitch ends up being quite tight and unyielding so keep an eye on that for this edge maybe give the scrunchie a yank every dozen stitches or so 4 dianna truong version 1b july 2025 colourwork patterns for patterns you are working them from the bottom right you go along the row from right to left and the row go bottom to top you are basically doing the pattern pixel by pixel same idea applies to crochet colourwork too
